PANIC.message: Panic button: Press, if something seems broken, to reload the extension.

SETTINGS_TAB_APPEARANCE_SHOW_CLOSE_BUTTO.message: Each tab will have a small button on it, that can be clicked to close the tab.

SETTINGS_TAB_APPEARANCE_ANIMATE_TEXT.message: If you do not like the tab animations, you can turn them off with this setting.

SETTINGS_TAB_TREES_USE_IN_FILTERS.message: Use tree view also in filter groups

SETTINGS_TAB_TREES_USE_IN_FILTERS_TEXT.message: When in tree view mode, the display of tabs as a tree can be explicitly prevented inside of filter groups. This can be useful since the tree structure not necessarily corresponds to the expected sorting order.

SETTINGS_TAB_TREES_MAX_LEVEL_TEXT.message: Defines the maximum depth of the tab tree. I.e. with a lower level children will not be pushed as far to the right in the tree.

SETTINGS_TAB_TREE_CLOSING_NEVER.message: Do not close children, when parent is closed

SETTINGS_TAB_TREE_CLOSING_NEVER_TEXT.message: Child tabs are never closed automatically, when their parent is closed.

SETTINGS_TAB_TREE_CLOSING_COLLAPSED.message: Close children only, if parent is collapsed

SETTINGS_TAB_TREE_CLOSING_COLLAPSED_TEXT.message: Child tabs will only be closed of the parent was closed in a collapsed state.

SETTINGS_TAB_TREE_CLOSING_ALWAYS.message: Always close children, when parent is closed

SETTINGS_TAB_TREE_CLOSING_ALWAYS_TEXT.message: Child tabs are always closed, when their parent is closed.

SETTINGS_GROUP_APPEARANCE_SHOW_GROUPS_TE.message: Shows the group bar. If you do not want to use the groups features, you can disable them and have more space for the tabs.

SETTINGS_GROUP_APPEARANCE_SHOW_GROUPS_BA.message: Hides the dark group bar background.

SETTINGS_GROUP_NEW_TABS_NEXT.message: Create new tabs next to current tab

SETTINGS_GROUP_NEW_TABS_NEXT_TEXT.message: New Tabs created inside a group are automatically placed below the current tab, if present.

SETTINGS_GROUP_NEW_BOTTOM_NEXT_TEXT.message: New tabs created inside a group are automatically placed at the bottom.

SETTINGS_SCROLL_BAR_DEFAULT_TEXT.message: This option will use the system default scrollbar in the sidebar.

SETTINGS_SCROLL_BAR_SLIM_TEXT.message: The default scrollbar is replaced with a thinner version. It is better suited, if you scroll with a mouse wheel and only need a position indicator.

SETTINGS_SCROLL_BAR_HIDDEN_TEXT.message: The scrollbar in the side bar is hidden completely. There is more space for tabs, but you will need a mouse wheel for scrolling.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_USE_TEXT.message: If you find the sidebar too empty and boring, you can use custom backgrounds to make it more visually appealing.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_IMAGE_TEXT.message: You can specify the image to be used as a background. Either use a local file or specify a Url to the image.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_OFFSET_TEXT.message: Use this slider to specify what section of the image to show on the sidebar.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_USE_FILTER_TEXT.message: Not using image filters can save memory.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_BLUR_TEXT.message: The image can be blurred to reduce distracting details.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_OPACITY_TEXT.message: The image opacity specifies how visible the background image is.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_GRAYSCALE_TEXT.message: This setting reduces the saturation of an image.

SETTINGS_BACKGROUND_TAB_OPACITY_TEXT.message: Tab opacity specifies, how much of the background is visible through the tabs.
